thread.title: Prep football previews: Warriors, Wildcats tangle as area teams face league matchups
thread.title_full: Prep football previews: Warriors, Wildcats tangle as area teams face league matchups

author: Conor O'Neill
title: Prep football previews: Warriors, Wildcats tangle as area teams face league matchups
text: Posted Oct. 23, 2015 at 12:52 AM Updated at 12:59 AM Western Alamance (6-2, 4-1) at Eastern Guilford (4-4, 2-3) Western Alamance is coming off a 38-3 defeat of Rockingham County, while Eastern Guilford has lost three straight games, including last week’s 35-7 outing at Northern Guilford. … Western Alamance has turned the ball over a combined seven times in its past three games. … The only two times Western Alamance has lost this season are the only games in which it surrendered more than 40 points. Eastern Guilford hasn’t scored more than 36 points in any game, and that high point came in the season opener. … Eastern Guilford has scored a combined 24 points during its three-game losing streak. … Eastern Guilford has scored fewer points than every other team in the Mid-State 3-A Conference except Williams High School. … This is the fourth straight season that Eastern Guilford has endured a losing streak of at least three games in league action. … Western Alamance won last season’s matchup 20-17 and has beaten the Wildcats in each of the past six seasons. Eastern Alamance (8-0, 5-0) at Rockingham County (4-5, 3-3) Eastern Alamance comes off its open week to face a Rockingham County team that has lost back-to-back games in which it combined to score 10 points. … Eastern Alamance has scored at least 40 points in six of eight games. … Quarterback John Lamot has completed 66.8 percent of his passes and is responsible for 32 touchdowns (22 rushing, 10 passing). … The combined record of Eastern Alamance’s last three opponents — Rockingham County, Eastern Guilford and Northeast Guilford — is 9-16. … The Eagles’ margin of victory for their first six games was an average of 36.8 points. In the previous two games, Eastern Alamance won 41-33 and 48-37 against Northern Guilford and Western Alamance, respectively. … Rockingham County is coming off a 38-3 thrashing at the hands of Western Alamance. … The Cougars are 1-3 at home, the lone victory coming against McMichael. … Eastern Alamance won last season’s matchup 49-0 and has beaten the Cougars seven times in the past six years, including a state-playoff matchup in 2010. Williams (4-5, 2-4) at McMichael (2-6, 0-5) Williams tries to keep the momentum rolling after back-to-back victories in which the Bulldogs didn’t allow a touchdown (6-3 vs. Eastern Guilford, 23-0 vs. Northeast Guilford). … This is the first time since 2005 that Williams has held opponents without touchdowns in back-to-back performances. … Before last week’s victory, Williams’ last shutout came against Graham in 2009. … Bulldogs running back Isaiah Coleman became the second area player — after Eastern Alamance’s Lamot — to reach 1,000 yards rushing for the season last week, and has 1,039 this year. … McMichael has lost five straight games, all of which have been Mid-State 3-A Conference games. The Phoenix’s last league victory came in a 21-12 result against Rockingham County in September of last year. … McMichael has already scored 21 more points than it did last season. … Williams won last season’s matchup 43-14 and has beaten McMichael in six straight seasons. Page 2 of 3 - Southern Alamance (4-4, 1-1) at Southeast Guilford (6-2, 1-1) Southern Alamance heads into an All Metro Conference matchup in search of its second league victory. The Patriots haven’t won more than one conference game in a season since 2010. … Last week’s 55-0 loss to Greensboro Dudley was the first time the Patriots have been shut out this season, and was the largest margin of defeat since a 70-0 loss to Greensboro Page in 2011. … Southern Alamance was without running back Kymani Dula, the team’s leading rusher, to start last week’s game. Mikal Slade, the team’s second-leading rusher, was hurt on the opening kickoff and didn’t play again. … Southern Alamance coach Andrew Carrouth, who’s in his third season at the helm of his alma mater, spent six seasons as an assistant coach with Southeast Guilford before taking over the Patriots. … Southeast Guilford is coming off a 28-25 victory against Greensboro Smith a week after a 49-7 thrashing at the hands of Greensboro Page. … Southeast Guilford won last season’s meeting 49-14 and has victories against Southern Alamance in each of the last six seasons. The Falcons and Patriots have combined to score 218 points in their last three matchups. Bartlett Yancey (4-3, 1-1) at Cummings (2-6, 1-1) These are two of the four teams in the Mid-State 2-A Conference tied for second place. … Bartlett Yancey was awarded a victory by forfeit against Carrboro last week, while Cummings lost 15-7 to first-place Reidsville. … Bartlett Yancey’s Shay Shay Jeffers leads the team with 974 yards of total offense, 844 of which is rushing yardage. He’s averaging 6.7 yards per touch. … Bartlett Yancey and Reidsville (5-3) are the only teams in the Mid-State 2-A Conference with winning overall records. … Cummings quarterback Ryan Boswell crossed the 1,000-yard plateau for passing yards this season, despite missing two games. … This is Cummings’ final home game of the regular season. … The Cavaliers are averaging 17.6 points per game, a mark that would be the program’s lowest average since the 2008 season. … Cummings won last season’s meeting 40-21 and has beaten Bartlett Yancey in each of the past six years. Graham (2-6, 1-1) at Carrboro (0-8, 0-2) Graham looks to build off of the momentum established with last week’s four-point victory against Jordan-Matthews. … The Red Devils’ 37 points were the second-most they’ve scored this season, while the 33 points allowed were the second-lowest total. … The combined record of Graham’s remaining opponents (Carrboro, Cummings and Bartlett Yancey) is 6-17. … Graham quarterback Jamie Newman entered last week’s game with 62 rushing yards and no scores on the ground. He ran for 82 yards and three touchdowns against the Jets. … Carrboro has lost 12 straight games dating to last season, when the Jaguars defeated Bartlett Yancey in their Mid-State 2-A Conference opener. … Carrboro forfeited last week’s game against Bartlett Yancey because of injuries and a concern that it wouldn’t field a full team. … Graham won last season’s matchup 28-21. Page 3 of 3 - Eastern Randolph (4-4, 1-1) at High Point Andrews (7-1, 2-0) Eastern Randolph matches up against the top team in the PAC-6 Conference and one of the top-ranked teams in Class 2-A. … Last week’s 20-16 loss to Providence Grove snapped the Wildcats’ three-game winning streak. … Eastern Randolph has allowed a combined 16 points in its four victories and surrendered a combined 149 points in its four losses. … High Point Andrews has won seven straight since losing 28-21 to Southwest Guilford. … Since that season-opening loss, the Red Raiders have held each opponent other than Cummings to less than 10 points (High Point Andrews beat Cummings 36-10 on Sept. 18). … High Point Andrews is averaging 39.4 points per game during its winning streak. … Eastern Randolph won last season’s meeting 35-34 in overtime after losing 45-10 in the 2013 version of this matchup.
